Re: License #: CB330314400
Dear Krista Stevens:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
March 3, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather A Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social
services worker that has children placed in the home.
Two of two special evaluations did not have documentation that a copy of the
report was provided to the foster care worker.
2

CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(b) Inform the foster parent, in writing, that he or she
has a right to have his or her written response included
as an attachment to the report required by subrule (5)
of this rule.
Two of two special evaluations did not document the foster family was informed of
their right to provide a written response.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child’s record before a change of placement occurs: (a-
j)
One of three foster care files did not have documentation to verify the required
information was provided to the foster parents prior to placement.
CPA Rule 400.12604 Orientation and application
(1) An agency shall provide an orientation for
prospective applicants for adoption before an adoptive
applicaiton is provided. The orientation shall include a
review of all of the following:
(a) Program statement, policies, and procedures.
One of four adoption family files held documentation that an application was
provided prior to completion of orientation.
3

CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
Two of four adoption family assessments were not completed within 90 days of
application.
CPA Rule 400.12607 Agency recommendation
(4) An agency shall provide the applicants for adoption
with a signed and dated copy of the evaluation and
recommendation upon its completion.
One of four adoption family assessments did not have documentation on file to
verify a copy of the report was provided to the applicant.
DHHS Policy ADM 330 Quarterly Adoption Progress Report
The adoption worker must have at least one face-to-
face contact with the child during each quarter prior to
the adoption supervision period for the purpose of
completing the DHS-614.
One of three quarterly child assessments did not have a quarterly face-to-face
visit documented from May to October 2022.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Annual/renewal foster home evaluations: the agency was advised to
ensure separate interviews are documented with all members of the
household. Specifically document what type of discipline is reported by all
household members.
4

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Not requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period. An investigation was completed on 9/28/22, in which it was
determined a foster parent "flicked" a child to get their attention. A CAP was
developed and implemented, which included retraining and review of agency policy.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
One CAP was submitted as a result of the 2/28/22 renewal evaluation. During this
interim review, no repeat violations were found. The agency was found to have
implemented their 2022 CAP effectively.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The 2/20/2023 Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed
on-site. The CAA was consistent with the findings of this evaluation. The agency has
had some difficulty with staffing this year but has continued to problem solve and
ensure appropriate staffing to manage cases effectively.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported a need for additional staffing.
However, both staff also reported feeling supported by the agency. Staff stated
supervisors and administrators are knowledgeable, helpful, and truly care about
them as individuals. Staff report the agency is flexible with work options, which helps
maintain a work/life balance.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space. File storage was viewed and found to
be secure.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
5

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
